summary: Internal FBI email chain regarding a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request about Jeffrey Epstein. The FBI's Records Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) notifies the Chief Division Counsel in New York about the request, provides the associated file number, and asks standard questions to determine how to handle the request in relation to any pending investigation.

persons.name: Bill Stevens
persons.context: Individual who submitted the Freedom of Information Act request concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the FOIA request and the associated FBI investigation file.

events.title: FOIA Request Initiation
events.description: Internal FBI email is sent regarding a pending FOIA request (IS 1424728) concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FOIA Response Deadline
events.description: The deadline for the FBI's New York office to respond to the internal FOIA coordination request.

keyFacts: An FBI file related to Jeffrey Epstein exists under the number 31E-NY-3027571.
The FBI's Records Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) is processing a FOIA request from Bill Stevens regarding Epstein and is coordinating with the New York field office.
The internal email asks the New York office to clarify the status of any pending investigation involving Epstein to determine what information can be released.
The document indicates the FBI was actively managing information about Epstein as of January 2019, considering potential exemptions to disclosure.
